Complex 1.temperature: 100 °C for 48 h, then 5 °C for over a month

Complex 2.temperature: 100 °C for 48 h, then 15 °C for over a month

Complex 3.temperature: 100 °C for 48 h, then 30 °C for over a month

Complex 4.temperature: 100 °C for 48 h, then 50 °C for over a month

Interconversion Reaction.description: Starting with any product in its mother liquor, the interconversion reactions were carried out by fine tuning of the temperature of the sealed container. In the solution, the initial compound dissolved gradually followed by crystallization of the corresponding compound, of which the proportion also increased progressively.

Computational Details.methodology: First principle density functional theory calculations with the CASTEP module
Computational Details.additional_information: The phonon contribution to the free energy is not considered due to relatively large unit cells used in the study.
